markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Dubious Knowledge](/Feats.aspx?ID=776) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 260 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
trained in a skill with the [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) action

</column>

---

You're a treasure trove of information, but not all of it comes from reputable sources. When you fail (but don't critically fail) a [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) check using any skill, you learn a bit of true knowledge and a bit of erroneous knowledge, but you don't have any way to differentiate which is which.
name: Dubious Knowledge
prerequisite: trained in a skill with the Recall Knowledge action
prerequisite_markdown: trained in a skill with the [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) action

</additional-info>

---

<summary>
Learn true and erroneous knowledge on failed check.
</summary>
summary: Learn true and erroneous knowledge on failed check.
summary_markdown: Learn true and erroneous knowledge on failed check.
text: <title level="1" right="Feat 1" pfs="Standard" > Dubious Knowledge Source Core Rulebook pg. 260 4.0 Prerequisites trained in a skill with the Recall Knowledge action --- You're a treasure trove of information, but not all of it comes from reputable sources. When you fail (but don't critically fail) a Recall Knowledge check using any skill, you learn a bit of true knowledge and a bit of erroneous knowledge, but you don't have any way to differentiate which is which.
